title: Hidden Triples
description: When three digits only appear in three cells of a house, all other candidates can be removed from those cells.

steps.title: What are Hidden Triples?
steps.content: A Hidden Triple occurs when three digits are candidates in exactly the same three cells within a house, and those digits don't appear as candidates in any other cells of that house. All other candidates can be removed from those three cells.

steps.title: Hidden vs. Naked Triples
steps.content: In a Naked Triple, the three cells contain only the triple's digits. In a Hidden Triple, the cells may have additional candidates â€” but the three key digits are restricted to just those three cells. The extra candidates are what makes them 'hidden'.

steps.title: Find the hidden triple
steps.content: Look at this column. The digits 1, 6, and 9 only appear as candidates in three specific cells. No other cells in the column can contain these digits.

steps.title: The deduction
steps.content: Since 1, 6, and 9 can only go in these three cells, these cells must contain exactly 1, 6, and 9. Therefore, all other candidates in these cells can be safely removed.

steps.title: Clean up candidates
steps.content: Remove every candidate except 1, 6, and 9 from the three cells. This simplifies the cells and may reveal Naked Singles or enable further techniques in intersecting houses.

steps.title: Searching systematically
steps.content: For each house, tally which cells contain each digit. Group digits that share the same set of cells. If three digits all appear in only three cells, you have a Hidden Triple.

steps.title: Why they're hard to find
steps.content: Hidden Triples are among the harder techniques to spot manually because you need to track where specific digits can go across a house while ignoring the 'noise' of other candidates. Practice and pencil marks are essential.

steps.title: When to use this technique
steps.content: Hidden Triples typically appear in hard-level puzzles. If you've exhausted Naked/Hidden Singles, pairs, and pointing pairs without progress, start looking for Hidden Triples.
